comment.shortText: Creates an instance of the All class.
Creates an instance of the All class.
The key to lazily resolve all matches for.
Called by the container to resolve all matching dependencies as an array of instances.
comment.returns: Returns an array of all matching instances.

comment.text: The container to resolve from.

comment.shortText: Creates an All Resolver for the supplied key.
comment.returns: Returns an insance of All for the key.

comment.text: The key to resolve all instances for.

comment.shortText: A lightweight, extensible dependency injection container.
Creates an instance of Container.
Creates an instance of Container.
Provides some configuration for the new Container instance.
The parent container in the DI hierarchy.
The root container in the DI hierarchy.
Registers a type (constructor function) by inspecting its registration annotations. If none are found, then the default singleton registration is used.

comment.text: The constructor function to use when the dependency needs to be instantiated.
The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.

comment.shortText: Registers an array of types (constructor functions) by inspecting their registration annotations. If none are found, then the default singleton registration is used.

comment.text: The constructor function to use when the dependency needs to be instantiated.

comment.shortText: Creates a new dependency injection container whose parent is the current container.
comment.returns: Returns a new container instance parented to this.

comment.shortText: Resolves a single instance based on the provided key.

comment.text: The key that identifies the object to resolve.

comment.shortText: Resolves all instance registered under the provided key.
comment.returns: Returns an array of the resolved instances.

comment.text: The key that identifies the objects to resolve.

comment.shortText: Inspects the container to determine if a particular key has been registred.
comment.returns: Returns true if the key has been registred; false otherwise.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.
Indicates whether or not to check the parent container hierarchy.

comment.shortText: Invokes a function, recursively resolving its dependencies.
comment.returns: Returns the instance resulting from calling the function.

comment.text: The function to invoke with the auto-resolved dependencies.
Additional function dependencies to use during invocation.

comment.shortText: Makes this container instance globally reachable through Container.instance.
Registers an additional key that serves as an alias to the original DI key.

comment.text: The key that originally identified the dependency; usually a constructor function.
An alternate key which can also be used to resolve the same dependency  as the original.

comment.shortText: Registers a custom resolution function such that the container calls this function for each request to obtain the instance.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.
The resolution function to use when the dependency is needed.

comment.shortText: Registers an existing object instance with the container.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.
The instance that will be resolved when the key is matched.

comment.shortText: Registers a custom resolution function such that the container calls this function for each request to obtain the instance.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.
The resolver to use when the dependency is needed.

comment.shortText: Registers a type (constructor function) such that the container always returns the same instance for each request.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.

comment.shortText: Registers a type (constructor function) such that the container returns a new instance for each request.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.

comment.shortText: Sets an invocation handler creation callback that will be called when new InvocationsHandlers are created (called once per Function).

comment.text: The callback to be called when an InvocationsHandler is created.

comment.shortText: Unregisters based on key.

comment.text: The key that identifies the dependency at resolution time; usually a constructor function.

comment.shortText: An Invoker that is used to invoke a factory method.
The singleton instance of the FactoryInvoker.
Invokes the function with the provided dependencies.
comment.returns: The result of the function invocation.

comment.text: The calling container.
The constructor or factory function.
The dependencies of the function call.

comment.shortText: Invokes the function with the provided dependencies.
comment.returns: The result of the function invocation.

comment.text: The calling container.
The constructor or factory function.
The static dependencies of the function.
Additional dependencies to use during invocation.

comment.shortText: Stores the information needed to invoke a function.
Instantiates an InvocationDescription.
Instantiates an InvocationDescription.
The Function described by this description object.
The strategy for invoking the function.
The static dependencies of the function call.
The statically known dependencies of this function invocation.
The function to be invoked by this handler.
The invoker implementation that will be used to actually invoke the function.
Invokes the function.
comment.returns: The result of the function invocation.

comment.text: The calling container.
Additional dependencies to use during invocation.

comment.shortText: Creates an instance of the Lazy class.
Creates an instance of the Lazy class.
The key to lazily resolve.
Called by the container to lazily resolve the dependency into a lazy locator function.
comment.returns: Returns a function which can be invoked at a later time to obtain the actual dependency.

comment.text: The container to resolve from.

comment.shortText: Creates a Lazy Resolver for the supplied key.
comment.returns: Returns an insance of Lazy for the key.

comment.text: The key to lazily resolve.

comment.shortText: Creates an instance of the Optional class.
Creates an instance of the Optional class.
The key to optionally resolve for.
Indicates whether or not the parent container hierarchy should be checked.
Called by the container to provide optional resolution of the key.
comment.returns: Returns the instance if found; otherwise null.

comment.text: The container to resolve from.

comment.shortText: Creates an Optional Resolver for the supplied key.
comment.returns: Returns an insance of Optional for the key.

comment.text: The key to optionally resolve for.

comment.shortText: Creates an instance of the Parent class.
Creates an instance of the Parent class.
The key to resolve from the parent container.
Called by the container to load the dependency from the parent container
comment.returns: Returns the matching instance from the parent container

comment.text: The container to resolve the parent from.

comment.shortText: Creates a Parent Resolver for the supplied key.
comment.returns: Returns an insance of Parent for the key.

comment.text: The key to resolve.

comment.shortText: Used to allow functions/classes to indicate that they should be registered as singletons with the container.
Creates an instance of SingletonRegistration.
Creates an instance of SingletonRegistration.
Called by the container to register the resolver.

comment.text: The container the resolver is being registered with.
The key the resolver should be registered as.
The function to create the resolver for.

comment.shortText: Creates an instance of the StrategyResolver class.
Creates an instance of the StrategyResolver class.
The type of resolution strategy.
The state associated with the resolution strategy.
Called by the container to allow custom resolution of dependencies for a function/class.

comment.text: The container to resolve from.
The key that the resolver was registered as.

comment.shortText: Used to allow functions/classes to indicate that they should be registered as transients with the container.
Creates an instance of TransientRegistration.
Creates an instance of TransientRegistration.
The key to register as.
Called by the container to register the resolver.

comment.text: The container the resolver is being registered with.
The key the resolver should be registered as.
The function to create the resolver for.

comment.shortText: Used to configure a Container instance.
A strategy for invoking a function, resulting in an object instance.
Customizes how a particular function is resolved by the Container.
Used to allow functions/classes to specify custom dependency resolution logic.
Decorator: Indicates that the decorated class/object is a custom resolver.
Decorator: Directs the TypeScript transpiler to write-out type metadata for the decorated class.
Decorator: Specifies that the decorated item should be called as a factory function, rather than a constructor.
Decorator: Specifies the dependencies that should be injected by the DI Container into the decoratored class/function.
Decorator: Specifies a custom Invoker for the decorated item.
Decorator: Specifies a custom registration strategy for the decorated class/function.
Decorator: Specifies to register the decorated item with a "singleton" lieftime.
Decorator: Specifies to register the decorated item with a "transient" lifetime.
